title: fifidap511
author: fifidap511
content: Hi Bitcoin world,I am trying to find a reliable and anonymous exchanger to convert btc to eth.Do you have any advice?Thanks!

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Check this list https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5218464.0I'm not going to try to recommend you of either one, some have ANN threads on this forum. Hope you make your own approach which is best based on the reviews they have received and do it from a small amount first to start with.DYOR.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: One option for anonymously exchanging BTC to ETH is to use a decentralized exchange (DEX). These types of exchanges operate on a blockchain and do not require users to create an account or provide personal information. However, the trade-off is that DEXs often have limited liquidity and may not be as user-friendly as centralized exchanges. Another option is to use a centralized exchange that allows users to trade BTC for ETH without requiring identity verification. But before using any exchange platform, it is always a good idea to do your own research and due diligence.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Fixedfloat.It's an instant exchange, no kyc, no registration, you just have to send what you want to exchange and then put your receiving address. Wait until 1 confirmation for your btc transfer and they'll process it quickly automatically until the exchanging is done.Majority of the coins that they're supporting are the ones from the top rank and obviously, btc and eth are there too.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: jossiel on December 20, 2022, 12:34:40 PMFixedfloat.It's an instant exchange, no kyc, no registration, you just have to send what you want to exchange and then put your receiving address. Wait until 1 confirmation for your btc transfer and they'll process it quickly automatically until the exchanging is done.Majority of the coins that they're supporting are the ones from the top rank and obviously, btc and eth are there too.I used fixed float in the past, but I saw some members complaining about it recently. OP DYOR before using such services. Carefully comb through the terms of service before you send in any funds. Things can change very fast in the crypto industry.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on December 20, 2022, 09:00:19 PMQuote from: jossiel on December 20, 2022, 12:34:40 PMFixedfloat.It's an instant exchange, no kyc, no registration, you just have to send what you want to exchange and then put your receiving address. Wait until 1 confirmation for your btc transfer and they'll process it quickly automatically until the exchanging is done.Majority of the coins that they're supporting are the ones from the top rank and obviously, btc and eth are there too.I used fixed float in the past, but I saw some members complaining about it recently. OP DYOR before using such services. Carefully comb through the terms of service before you send in any funds. Things can change very fast in the crypto industry.What could be the complains that they've faced using fixedfloat? Luckily on my end, I have never met any problem upon using them.But I agree that it's still better for OP to DYOR so that he'll get the good and bad feedback for any service that will be suggested on him.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Here is a list https://www.bestchange.com/bitcoin-to-ethereum.html (I have them in my signature)also here is the ANN thread from the Best_Change monitoring service, you can ask if you have any doubts https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3309245.0still regardless of all the suggestions, always do your own research before sending money anywhere.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Unfortunately there's no decentralized exchange offer 100% anonymous, the only decentralized exchange that offer better privacy is only Bisq. In this exchange you can use Tor browser, unlike the other decentralized exchange where you can't use Tor browser and they will record your IP address. If you want to make your coins is completely anonymous, you need to use Bitcoin mixer first before send your coins to decentralized exchange.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: Jawhead999 on December 21, 2022, 05:22:36 AM~ Bisq. In this exchange you can use Tor browser, unlike the other decentralized exchange where you can't use Tor browser and they will record your IP address.Bisq is a desktop-based decentralized exchange, it's not a web-based application. Hence, it does not use Tor Browser, it just uses Tor to connect to the networks. Tor Browser is just an overhauled browser with Tor network connectivity by default, the Tor itself are kind-of proxy that can be used in any application.Though, recommending Bisq is a good way for those seeking the utmost privacy. As for looking at the ETH/BTC liquidity pair, refer to: https://bisq.markets/market/eth_btc, there is a plenty of offers that are going on. @OP, you can learn more at https://bisq.network/getting-started/.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: fifidap511 on December 19, 2022, 01:14:06 PMHi Bitcoin world,I am trying to find a reliable and anonymous exchanger to convert btc to eth.Do you have any advice?Thanks!Â  I prefer Atomic Wallet, you can exchange your bitcoins for Ethereum with good fees and you do not need KYC, also the Godex.io platform and Letsexchange.io are the best for me as you can do many transactions anonymously and there are a lot of altcoins supported in addition to Simple interfaces, if we look at the Google search results, there are also many exchange platforms, but keep in mind that there are scam exchange platforms, so before you deposit any Bitcoin, you should look at the feedbacks of customers who tried the platforms and succeeded in withdrawing their funds and see reviews about them on YouTube or Trustpilot, you should make some effort so you not to lose your crypto.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: albon on December 21, 2022, 09:01:47 PMI prefer Atomic Wallet, you can exchange your bitcoins for Ethereum with good fees and you do not need KYC, also the Godex.io platform and Letsexchange.io are the best for me as you can do many transactions anonymously I'm not familiar with Godex or Letsexchange but as far as I know, Atomic Wallet uses Changenow to process the transaction. So, the KYC policy might change and get complicated even if you don't use Changenow directly. There have been many negative discussions about Changenow in the past iirc, so anyone interested in using them is recommended to research more about them.Changenow aside, so many of these instant exchanges don't offer their own exchange but connect to other services like Changelly, Changenow, etc. I've seen so many KYC complaints in the past even if the transaction amount is allegedly low. So be careful when using them. If you don't want to risk it, you better use Bisq or something similar if converting to BTC is the only thing that you need.

So, the KYC policy might change and get complicated even if you don't use Changenow directly. So be careful when using them. If you don't want to risk it, you better use Bisq or something similar if converting to BTC is the only thing that you need.That's usually what these instant exchanges or swaps do as we know. I think I'm familiar with godex but never have used them. I'd like to add and also recommend bisq.Although some of the mentioned are really convenient to use but not until they randomly ask you with kyc even if the transaction you're about to do isn't that much.@OP, how you doing, which exchange/swap you chose?

comments.body: Quote from: blockman on January 04, 2023, 11:17:19 AM@OP, how you doing, which exchange/swap you chose?For some reason Op is no longer present and active in the thread he made afterwards, I doubt he really needs an answer to what he asked because he never replied to a single response in his thread. From every response there is bisq which is highly recommended because Op expects anonymous exchange only he has to download bisq.network and this can be reticent but bisq can be trusted as many forum members recommend it.

Well, anyway maybe it's already done and he's able to swap the BTC that he's got into ETH and the thread's purpose is done and should be closed already.

comments.author: kelonmusk
comments.body: If you to exchanging BTC for ETH, there are a few things to keep in mind. First, you want to make sure you're using a reliable and trustworthy exchange platform. Second, if you're looking for anonymity, you may want to consider using a decentralized exchange (DEX) instead of a centralized one.So, I suggest checking out platforms like Bisq, LocalCryptos, or Uniswap. These are all reputable options that allow for BTC to ETH conversions and prioritize user privacy. Of course, it's always a good idea to do your own research and make sure the platform you choose meets your specific needs and requirements. I hope this helps you.

comments.author: kelonmusk
comments.body: Quote from: albon on December 21, 2022, 09:01:47 PMQuote from: fifidap511 on December 19, 2022, 01:14:06 PMHi Bitcoin world,I am trying to find a reliable and anonymous exchanger to convert btc to eth.Do you have any advice?Thanks!Â  I prefer Atomic Wallet, you can exchange your bitcoins for Ethereum with good fees and you do not need KYC, also the Godex.io platform and Letsexchange.io are the best for me as you can do many transactions anonymously and there are a lot of altcoins supported in addition to Simple interfaces, if we look at the Google search results, there are also many exchange platforms, but keep in mind that there are scam exchange platforms, so before you deposit any Bitcoin, you should look at the feedbacks of customers who tried the platforms and succeeded in withdrawing their funds and see reviews about them on YouTube or Trustpilot, you should make some effort so you not to lose your crypto.While it's great that you have found success with Atomic Wallet, Godex.io, and Letsexchange.io, I think it's important to keep in mind that everyone's needs are different when it comes to crypto payment gateways. Some people may prioritize security over anonymity, or may prioritize a wider range of altcoins over simple interfaces.Â  So, there is no one "ideal" crypto payment gateway that is perfect for everyone, so it's important to consider your own needs and preferences when making a decision.Additionally, while it is crucial to be cautious of scam exchange platforms, I suggest that it's not always enough to rely solely on customer feedback and reviews on sites like YouTube or Trustpilot.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Quote from: kelonmusk on March 20, 2023, 02:43:07 PMAdditionally, while it is crucial to be cautious of scam exchange platforms, I suggest that it's not always enough to rely solely on customer feedback and reviews on sites like YouTube or Trustpilot. I agree on you this one. There could be paid videos made to destroy a reputation but at the same time, the opposite is also possible with it that there can be videos and reviews paid to make an exchange or service become better in the eyes of those potential customers.It's never enough to rely to one reviews website and YT isn't really a good place when it's about questioning the reputation of an exchange that you'll use. OP never come back after asking this question so, expecting this thread to be locked soon.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: if you have a small amount you can ask other members here with escrow. or you can use third platform like Bestchange and other Built in app on trustwallet and guard now offer swap to. so a lot of option but I do recommended P2P than using a centralized exchange

comments.author: merekamo
comments.body: I think this topic already discuss, you can search in this forum. But, I'd suggest checking out some decentralized exchanges (DEX) like Uniswap or Sushiswap. Yeah, they can offer more anonymity compared to centralized exchanges. I think, another option some exchanges do offer more privacy-focused options, such as using a pseudonym or requiring less personal information to create an account.I would recommend looking into some of the more established exchanges that have a proven track record of reliability and security, such as Coinbase, Binance, or Kraken. It's also worth considering using a peer-to-peer exchange like LocalCryptos, which allows you to trade directly with other individuals without the need for an intermediary process, which may not be as anonymous as you'd like. Good luck bro.
